_header: Then shall stint that now is kid
Bibliographic Ghosts: Oxford, Lincoln College Lat. 52: not in this MS; Edinburgh, Edinburgh University Library 82: not in this MS
_description: Two couplets in the Fasciculus morum translating the Latin divisio of a sermon for the second Sunday of Advent

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
then shall stynte þat now is kudthen shall sein þat now is
                    hudethen shall dere þat now is likudthen shal lyk þat now is
                    nyede

BodLauMis568.Transcription:
þu schalt stynt þat now ys kudthan schal seme þat now
                    ys hudthane schal noþ þat now likudþat schal lyke
                    þat now ny eth

Bod187.Transcription:
þanne shal stynte þat now ys kydþanne shal seme
                    þat now ys hydþanne shal newe þat now lykydþanne
                    shal lyke þan now [ ]
Bod187.Note: The last word of the text is erased.

Bod332.Transcription:
þan shal stynt þat now is kidþan shal seme þat
                    now is hidþan shal dere þat now likythþan shal like
                    þat now swikith

OxfCCC218.Transcription:
Þanne schal stynte that now is kudÞanne schal seme that now
                    is hudÞanne schal dere that now likethÞanne schal like that
                    now nyeth
OxfCCC218.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 199.

CamGon71.Transcription:
þanne schal it stynt þat now ys cowdeþanne schal seme
                    þat now is hyddþanne schal dere þat now lykyth&
                    þanne schal lyke þat now is wykked

Spalding.Transcription:
þan shall stynt þat now is kydþan shall shewe þat
                    nowe is hydþan shall dere that now is lykydþan shall like
                    þat are noyed

WorcF19.Transcription:
Whan schall stint þat now ys kudThen schal seme þat now ys
                    hudWhen sall dere þat now lykyd…
WorcF19.Note: Imperfect in this MS, written as prose.

VaticanOtto.Note: Imperfect in this MS, written as prose.
